comments:
Build 20020328

1) I opened a workspace from 20020321 in a new 20020328 build.  
2) Imported all binary projects over top of existing binary projects
3) Did some random editing and browsing
4) On shutdown I got the error below.  

Note that the missing file, swt-win32-2031.dll, had been replaced during the 
binary project import.  In the dtree code where it failed, it is basically 
saying, "I think I'm a node that represents a change from my parent, but there 
is no such node in my parent.  Therefore I represent a delta on an unknown 
quantity, which is invalid".  I don't know how the tree could have gotten into 
this state, but I will explore on Monday.

Note that even though writing the tree threw an exception, a subsequent startup 
suceeded, probably due to an existing tree backup file.

I have not been able to reproduce this.  If anyone else has experienced this 
lately, please post a follow-up comment.  Any additional information that could 
be contributed would be very useful.

All I remember with my occurrence was that I had to kill Eclipse (or was it the 
whole machine?) due to a lockup (out of memory?).  Apparently, the state of the 
tree widget is saved, but if the matching resources are gone, it complains?  
Just guessing here.

To get around this, I just built a completely new workspace.

Could not reproduce.
Please re-open if this is still a problem for you in the latest builds.

Build id: 200211141700

Hi,

got the same problem when killing eclipse during a "cvs team->update" that had
never been finished (after an hour i decided to kill eclipse). Got this three or
four times.
Maybe that's a possibility to reproduce the bug.

I'm using  Eclipse 2.1 (Build id: 200211141700) at work and a newer build (from
the first december week) at home.

Deleting the .metadata directory is an annoying "workaround". But it's okay for
now. I just have to recrate or recheckout the projects...that sucks a bit:).

with kind regards,
Florian


P.S.: Anyway, Eclipse is great - best IDE I've ever seen.   
Working with it is just fun.

This is a known bug, just haven't gotten around to fixing it yet.  

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 12575 ***
